oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Mickey Raphael - 2018-06-16
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with and performance by Mickey Raphael from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 16, 2018. Moderated by Bill Lloyd.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mickey Raphael;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: l(00:00) Walk-in music / (02:27) Opening announcements and host introduction by Abi Tapia / (04:26) Bill Lloyd introduction of past Nashville Cats in the audience and introduction of Mickey / (06:53) Plays video clip / (09:26) Mickey talks about his harmonica influences / (10:38) Talk about Bob Dylan and his harmonica playing / (11:44) Mickey gives a demonstration of harmonica's he plays / (14:25) Talks about his parents and growing up in Dallas, Texas / (16:04) Talks about his early music inspirations / (18:39) Talks about his earning his first harmonica / (19:33) Talks about Don Brooks being his harmonica mentor and plays an example of his style / (20:51) Talks about starting to play in clubs in and around Dallas / (21:19) Talks about playing with Ronnie Dawson / (22:07) Talks about playing with B.W. Stevenson and beginning to play for recording sessions during high school / (23:44) Plays excerpt of B.W. Stevenson's Maybe Mexico recording / (24:33) Talks about how he met Willie Nelson and starting to play with him / (28:17) Talks about joining Willie's band / (28:52) Talks about the venues he was playing with Willie at the time he joined him / (30:28) Talks about the Red-Headed Stranger album and the recording of it / (33:01) Mickey talks about the response to the Red-Headed Stranger album and the acceptance of it / (34:09) Plays recorded excerpt of the Red-headed Stranger album / (35:44) Talks about Willie's band / (37:17) Plays video clip / (40:08) Talks about his roles in motion pictures / (40:44) Plays video clip / (41:56) Talks about recording session work with other artists / (43:00) Talks about the differences of being a session player and a live musicians / (44:00) Plays recorded excerpts of some of Mickey's other session work / (46:51) Talks about recording the Beach Boys and Willie Nelson's recording The Warmth Of The Son / (47:50) Talks about recording the Motley Crew version of Smokin' In The Boys Room and Elton John's version of The Fox / (49:26) Talks about working with Wynton Marsalis / (50:03) Plays video clips / (51:26) Talks about his interactions with Miles Davis / (53:00) Talks about flying with the Blue Angels / (55:04) Plays excerpted recordings / (58:15) Bill reads through Mickey recording credits / (01:00:15) Plays recorded excerpt / (01:00:56) Talks about the Naked Willie album which Mickey produced / (01:02:32) Talks about working with The Highwaymen and on the American Outlaws DVD and CD project / (01:04:09) Mickey talks about and describes some of the photographs being shown / (01:07:37) Bill thanks Mickey / (01:07:58) Mickey introduces the band (members of My Morning Jacket along with Bill Lloyd and Duane Eddy) / (01:09:08) Performance of Ain't It Funny How Time Slips Away / (01:12:56) Performance of Unidentified Song / (01:16:25) Performance of On The Road Again / (01:19:01) Final comments / (01:19:55) Walk-out music / (01:25:48) FILE END
